name: Europeana APIs
description: Provides access to metadata from thousands of cultural heritage institutions across Europe. The APIs enable search and retrieval of cultural heritage items from Europeana's collections.

endpoints.description: Search for metadata records and media in Europeana collections
Retrieve individual record metadata

research_notes.data_quality: High - comprehensive documentation with API console
research_notes.researcher_notes: Multiple APIs available including Search, Record, IIIF, Entity, Thumbnail, and Recommendation APIs. Requires free API key registration.
research_notes.api_summary: Europeana APIs provide comprehensive access to Europe's digital cultural heritage, supporting millions of items from thousands of institutions. The platform offers multiple specialized APIs for searching, retrieving records, accessing IIIF resources, and getting recommendations, making it invaluable for researchers, developers, and cultural organizations working with European heritage data.

name: Digital Public Library of America API
description: Provides programmatic access to over 15 million objects from libraries, museums, and archives across America. Enables search and retrieval of diverse cultural and historical materials.

endpoints.description: Search and retrieve individual items from DPLA collections
Access logical groupings of items

research_notes.data_quality: Excellent - comprehensive documentation with API codex
research_notes.researcher_notes: Well-documented API with libraries for Python, Java, PHP, R, and Ruby. Bulk download options available.
research_notes.api_summary: The DPLA API offers comprehensive access to America's digital cultural heritage, aggregating content from thousands of libraries, museums, and archives. It provides structured JSON-LD data for over 15 million items, making it an essential resource for researchers, educators, and developers working with American cultural materials and historical collections.

name: Internet Archive APIs
description: Comprehensive APIs for accessing archived web pages, books, movies, music, and other digital content. Includes Wayback Machine API for historical web data.

endpoints.description: Advanced search interface for Internet Archive items
endpoints.response_format: JSON with search results and metadata

endpoints.description: Check if URL is archived and get closest timestamp

content_summary.update_frequency: Continuous web crawling and user uploads

research_notes.data_quality: Good - multiple APIs with varying documentation levels
research_notes.researcher_notes: Multiple APIs including search, wayback, metadata, and upload. Python library available for easier integration.
research_notes.api_summary: Internet Archive APIs provide access to one of the world's largest digital libraries, containing billions of web pages, millions of books, movies, music recordings, and software programs. The APIs support both historical research through the Wayback Machine and access to contemporary digital collections, making it invaluable for digital preservation, academic research, and content discovery.

name: Google Books API
description: Programmatic access to Google Books content including search, metadata retrieval, and preview functionality. Enables developers to integrate book discovery into applications.

endpoints.description: Search for books and retrieve volume information
endpoints.response_format: JSON with book metadata and availability

endpoints.description: Retrieve specific volume information by ID

content_summary.update_frequency: Regular updates from publishers and scanning

research_notes.data_quality: Excellent - comprehensive Google developer documentation
research_notes.researcher_notes: Part of Google's suite of APIs, well-maintained with OAuth support for personal libraries.
research_notes.api_summary: Google Books API provides access to the world's largest collection of digitized books, offering comprehensive metadata, search capabilities, and preview functionality. It enables developers to build applications that can search millions of books, access detailed bibliographic information, and integrate with users' personal libraries, making it essential for educational, research, and commercial book-related applications.

name: Open Library API
description: Open, editable library catalog providing access to millions of books. Offers RESTful APIs for searching, retrieving book data, and checking availability.

access_info.rate_limits: rate limiting for high volume usage

endpoints.description: Search for books across the Open Library catalog
endpoints.response_format: JSON with search results and book metadata

endpoints.description: Retrieve book information using ISBNs, OCLCs, or other identifiers
endpoints.response_format: JSON with book metadata and availability

research_notes.data_quality: Good - community-maintained with comprehensive coverage
research_notes.researcher_notes: Open source project with Python client library. Supports multiple identifier systems.
research_notes.api_summary: Open Library API provides free access to a comprehensive, community-maintained catalog of millions of books and authors. It offers flexible search capabilities, detailed bibliographic data, and reading availability information, making it an essential resource for developers building library applications, researchers studying book collections, and educators creating reading-focused tools.

name: WorldCat Search API (Deprecated)
description: OCLC's WorldCat Search API v1.0 was deprecated as of December 31, 2024. OCLC now offers WorldCat Metadata API and other services for library catalog access.

endpoints.description: Search WorldCat catalog (deprecated)

research_notes.data_quality: High quality but transitioning to new APIs
research_notes.researcher_notes: WorldCat Search API v1.0 ended support December 2024. Current APIs include WorldCat Metadata API and Knowledge Base API.
research_notes.api_summary: OCLC's WorldCat APIs provide access to the world's largest library catalog, containing bibliographic records from thousands of libraries globally. While the original Search API has been deprecated, newer APIs like the WorldCat Metadata API continue to offer comprehensive access to library holdings, bibliographic data, and collection management capabilities for OCLC member institutions.

name: Library of Congress APIs
description: Comprehensive APIs providing access to the Library of Congress collections including Congress.gov data, digital collections, and bibliographic records.

access_info.rate_limits: 5,000 requests per hour for Congress.gov API

endpoints.description: Access congressional bills and legislation
Search LOC collections with fo=json parameter
endpoints.response_format: JSON with collection items and metadata

content_summary.update_frequency: Real-time for congressional data, regular for collections

research_notes.data_quality: Excellent - government-maintained with comprehensive documentation
research_notes.researcher_notes: Multiple APIs including Congress.gov v3 and LOC.gov JSON API. Rich GitHub resources available.
research_notes.api_summary: Library of Congress APIs provide unparalleled access to American legislative data and one of the world's largest library collections. The Congress.gov API offers real-time access to federal legislation, while the LOC.gov API provides structured access to millions of historical documents, photographs, maps, and cultural artifacts, making it essential for political research, digital humanities, and American studies.

name: British Library APIs
description: APIs for accessing British Library document supply services and digital collections. Includes BLDSS API for document ordering and catalog integration.

endpoints.description: Check document availability and pricing
endpoints.response_format: JSON with availability and pricing information

endpoints.description: Place document supply orders

content_summary.geographic_scope: Global document supply with UK focus

research_notes.data_quality: Professional service-oriented API
research_notes.researcher_notes: Focused on document supply services rather than open access to collections. Requires business account.
research_notes.api_summary: British Library APIs primarily serve document supply and interlibrary loan services through the BLDSS platform. They enable institutions to integrate British Library's comprehensive document delivery services directly into their library management systems, providing real-time availability checking, pricing, ordering, and tracking capabilities for academic and research materials.

name: Deutsche Digitale Bibliothek REST API
description: German Digital Library API providing access to digitized cultural heritage and research materials from German institutions. Uses OpenAPI 3.0 specification.

endpoints.description: Search across DDB collections
endpoints.response_format: JSON with search results and metadata

endpoints.description: Retrieve individual item metadata

research_notes.data_quality: Good - uses OpenAPI 3.0 specification
research_notes.researcher_notes: All metadata provided under CC0 license. Comprehensive documentation available in German and English.
research_notes.api_summary: Deutsche Digitale Bibliothek API provides access to Germany's national digital library, aggregating cultural heritage materials from hundreds of German institutions. The API offers comprehensive search capabilities and detailed metadata access under CC0 licensing, making it valuable for researchers studying German culture, history, and digital humanities projects focused on German-speaking regions.

name: Gallica APIs
description: Multiple APIs providing access to Gallica's digital collections including document metadata, search functionality, and IIIF image services.

endpoints.description: Search using SRU protocol with CQL queries
Retrieve bibliographic and technical information by ARK identifier

research_notes.data_quality: Excellent - multiple APIs with comprehensive documentation
research_notes.researcher_notes: Multiple APIs available including SRU search, document retrieval, and IIIF image access. Python and R wrappers available.
research_notes.api_summary: Gallica APIs provide comprehensive access to the digital collections of France's national library, offering millions of documents spanning centuries of French cultural heritage. The APIs support advanced search via SRU protocol, detailed metadata retrieval, and IIIF-compliant image access, making them essential for research in French studies, European history, and digital humanities projects.

name: Dimensions Analytics API
description: Subscription-based API providing access to comprehensive research data including publications, citations, grants, and patents for advanced analytics and visualization.

endpoints.description: Execute Dimensions Search Language (DSL) queries
endpoints.response_format: JSON with research data and metadata

content_summary.update_frequency: Regular updates with new research data

research_notes.data_quality: High - professional research analytics platform
research_notes.researcher_notes: Subscription-only service with DSL query language. Python client (DimCli) and Jupyter notebooks available.
research_notes.api_summary: Dimensions Analytics API provides sophisticated access to one of the world's largest linked research databases, enabling complex analytical queries across publications, citations, grants, and patents. Designed for institutional research assessment and competitive intelligence, it offers advanced search capabilities through DSL and comprehensive data linking, making it invaluable for research administrators, bibliometric analysts, and funding organizations.

name: DataCite Events API
description: Query API for DataCite Event Data service, providing access to scholarly events including citations, usage statistics, and data relationships.

access_info.rate_limits: 25 events per page, up to 10,000 total results

endpoints.description: Retrieve list of events filtered by various parameters
endpoints.response_format: JSON with event data and metadata

endpoints.description: Retrieve specific event by ID

research_notes.data_quality: Good - well-documented REST API
research_notes.researcher_notes: Provides linking and usage events for research outputs. Pagination supported with sortable results.
research_notes.api_summary: DataCite Events API provides access to a comprehensive collection of scholarly events including citations, usage metrics, and relationships between research outputs. It enables researchers and institutions to track how their data and publications are being used and cited, offering valuable insights into research impact and scholarly communication patterns across the global research ecosystem.

name: Scilit (No Public API)
description: Scilit is a comprehensive database for scientific publications that aggregates content from Crossref and PubMed, but does not currently offer a public API.

content_summary.update_frequency: Daily updates from Crossref and PubMed

research_notes.data_quality: Platform exists but no public API documented
research_notes.researcher_notes: Scilit aggregates data from Crossref and PubMed APIs but doesn't provide its own public API. Users should access source APIs directly.
research_notes.api_summary: Scilit is a comprehensive scientific literature database maintained by MDPI that aggregates content from major scholarly sources like Crossref and PubMed. While it provides a valuable search interface for scientific publications, it does not currently offer a public API for programmatic access. Researchers seeking API access to similar data should consider using the underlying source APIs (Crossref API, PubMed API) that Scilit itself uses for data aggregation.

name: BASE (Bielefeld Academic Search Engine) API
description: Search interface for academic repositories and open access content. Provides access to over 300 million documents from more than 10,000 content providers.

endpoints.description: Search BASE index using HTTP GET requests
endpoints.response_format: XML/JSON with search results and metadata

research_notes.data_quality: Good - requires IP whitelisting for access
research_notes.researcher_notes: Requires IP whitelisting before use. Built on Lucene/SOLR with Dublin Core metadata structure.
research_notes.api_summary: BASE API provides access to one of the world's largest academic search engines, aggregating content from thousands of open access repositories globally. The API enables programmatic searching across hundreds of millions of scholarly documents, making it valuable for research discovery, bibliometric analysis, and building academic search applications that require comprehensive coverage of open access literature.

name: OpenAIRE Graph API
description: Provides access to the OpenAIRE Research Graph, a comprehensive dataset of scholarly resources including publications, datasets, software, projects, and organizations.

endpoints.description: Search and retrieve research products (publications, datasets, software)
Access project information and funding data
endpoints.response_format: JSON with project and funding metadata

research_notes.data_quality: High - new Graph API with improved JSON outputs
research_notes.researcher_notes: New Graph API released with cursor-based pagination and improved data structure. Legacy Search API available until August 2025.
research_notes.api_summary: OpenAIRE Graph API provides access to one of the world's largest open scholarly communication graphs, connecting millions of research outputs with projects, organizations, and funding information. The API enables comprehensive research impact analysis and discovery across European and global research ecosystems, making it essential for research assessment, policy analysis, and scholarly communication studies.

name: ScholeXplorer API
description: Provides access to scholarly links between publications and datasets using the Scholix metadata format. Part of the broader OpenAIRE infrastructure.

endpoints.description: Find links from a given persistent identifier
Find links to a given persistent identifier

research_notes.data_quality: Good - follows Scholix framework standards
research_notes.researcher_notes: Provides 40M dataset and 24M publication relationships. Metadata available under CC-BY license.
research_notes.api_summary: ScholeXplorer API provides specialized access to scholarly links between research publications and datasets, enabling discovery of research connections that are often invisible in traditional bibliographic databases. Using the Scholix metadata framework, it offers insights into data-literature relationships, making it valuable for understanding research impact, data reuse patterns, and the interconnected nature of modern scholarly communication.

name: Scite.ai API
description: API for accessing citation context analysis, providing information on whether citations support, contradict, or mention research claims using deep learning.

endpoints.description: Get citation tallies showing supporting, contradicting, and mentioning citations

research_notes.data_quality: Specialized service for citation context analysis
research_notes.researcher_notes: Requires approval from customersupport@researchsolutions.com. Third-party implementations available in Python and R.
research_notes.api_summary: Scite.ai API provides advanced citation analysis by classifying how research papers cite other works, determining whether citations support, contradict, or merely mention the cited research. Using deep learning to analyze citation context, it offers unique insights into research reliability and scientific discourse, making it valuable for researchers, institutions, and publishers seeking to understand the true impact and verification status of scientific claims.

name: ORCID Public API
description: Public API for accessing researcher profiles and connecting scholarly activities. Enables search of public ORCID registry data and integration with research systems.

endpoints.description: Search public ORCID records
Retrieve public information from specific ORCID record

research_notes.data_quality: High - official researcher identity registry
research_notes.researcher_notes: Public API free for anyone. Member API available for institutions. Sandbox environment available for testing.
research_notes.api_summary: ORCID Public API provides free access to the world's largest registry of researcher identifiers and profile information. It enables discovery of researchers, their affiliations, and publicly shared scholarly activities, making it essential for institutional repositories, manuscript submission systems, funding applications, and any research infrastructure that needs to accurately identify and connect researchers with their work.

name: ROR (Research Organization Registry) API
description: Open API providing access to ROR's registry of research organizations worldwide. Offers comprehensive organizational metadata and hierarchical relationships.

endpoints.description: Search and filter organizations in ROR registry
Retrieve specific organization by ROR ID

research_notes.data_quality: High - community-curated registry with version 2 schema
research_notes.researcher_notes: CC0 licensed data with over 116,000 organizations. Data dumps available at Zenodo.
research_notes.api_summary: ROR API provides free access to the world's most comprehensive registry of research organizations, containing detailed metadata for over 116,000 institutions globally. It enables precise identification and disambiguation of research affiliations, making it essential for manuscript submission systems, funding databases, institutional repositories, and research assessment tools that need to accurately track organizational relationships in the research ecosystem.

name: Crossref Funder Registry API
description: Open API providing access to the Crossref Funder Registry (formerly FundRef). Note: Transitioning to ROR for organizational identifiers.

endpoints.description: List all funders in the registry
Find works associated with specific funder

research_notes.data_quality: Good but transitioning to ROR
research_notes.researcher_notes: Open Funder Registry announced transition to ROR in September 2023. ROR ID is now preferred method for funder identification.
research_notes.api_summary: Crossref Funder Registry API provides access to funding organization data and their associated research outputs, but is in transition to ROR (Research Organization Registry). While still functional, users are encouraged to transition to ROR IDs for future-proof funder identification. The API enables tracking of research funding patterns and institutional relationships, supporting research assessment and funding impact analysis.

name: GRID (Global Research Identifier Database) - Deprecated
description: GRID was retired from public use in Q4 2021. Digital Science transferred stewardship to ROR (Research Organization Registry) as the successor.

research_notes.data_quality: Deprecated - migrated to ROR
research_notes.researcher_notes: GRID was retired in Q4 2021. Users should migrate to ROR for organizational identifiers. Historical data may be accessible through Dimensions API.
research_notes.api_summary: GRID (Global Research Identifier Database) was a comprehensive database of research organizations that was deprecated in favor of ROR (Research Organization Registry) in 2021. Digital Science transferred stewardship to the community-driven ROR initiative to ensure continued maintenance and development. Users previously relying on GRID should migrate to ROR, which provides enhanced coverage and community governance for research organization identification.

name: Sherpa Romeo API v2
description: API providing access to publisher copyright and self-archiving policies. Part of the consolidated Sherpa Services platform.

endpoints.description: Retrieve publisher policy and journal information

research_notes.data_quality: Good - consolidated platform with JSON output
research_notes.researcher_notes: Version 2 API now returns JSON instead of XML. Consolidated with other Sherpa services into unified platform.
research_notes.api_summary: Sherpa Romeo API v2 provides comprehensive access to publisher copyright and self-archiving policies, enabling researchers and institutions to understand open access requirements and permissions. As part of the consolidated Sherpa Services platform, it offers structured policy data in JSON format, making it essential for institutional repositories, research management systems, and compliance tools that need to track and enforce open access mandates.

name: Sherpa Juliet API
description: API providing access to research funder open access policies. Integrated into the consolidated Sherpa Services platform as 'open policy finder'.

endpoints.description: Retrieve funder policy information through consolidated API

research_notes.data_quality: Good - consolidated into unified Sherpa platform
research_notes.researcher_notes: Consolidated with Romeo, Fact, and OpenDOAR into 'open policy finder' platform. Requires account creation for API access.
research_notes.api_summary: Sherpa Juliet API provides access to research funder open access policies and mandates through the consolidated Sherpa Services platform. It enables institutions and researchers to understand compliance requirements across different funding organizations, making it essential for research offices, institutional repositories, and grant management systems that need to ensure adherence to funder open access policies.

name: Open Research Europe (No Public API)
description: Open Research Europe is a publishing platform for Horizon 2020 and Horizon Europe beneficiaries but does not currently offer a public API.

research_notes.data_quality: Platform exists but no public API documented
research_notes.researcher_notes: Built on F1000 Research platform. May inherit F1000's API capabilities but no specific documentation found for Open Research Europe API.
research_notes.api_summary: Open Research Europe is a specialized publishing platform for European Commission-funded research that provides immediate open access publication and transparent peer review. While it operates on the F1000 Research infrastructure and may have underlying API capabilities, no public API documentation was found specifically for accessing Open Research Europe content programmatically. Researchers needing API access to EU research outputs should consider OpenAIRE APIs or contact the platform directly.

name: Wellcome Open Research API
description: API for accessing Wellcome-funded research publications. Built on F1000 Research platform with Solr-based search capabilities.

access_info.rate_limits: 100 requests per 60 seconds, 100 results per request

endpoints.description: Search Wellcome Open Research articles using Solr queries
Download links to XML of entire corpus
endpoints.response_format: XML URLs for all published articles

research_notes.data_quality: Good - built on established F1000 Research platform
research_notes.researcher_notes: Uses same API structure as F1000 Research with Solr-based search. No API key required for read access.
research_notes.api_summary: Wellcome Open Research API provides programmatic access to biomedical and health research publications funded by the Wellcome Trust. Built on the F1000 Research platform, it offers Solr-based search capabilities and full-text access to research articles, making it valuable for researchers studying Wellcome-funded research outputs, biomedical literature analysis, and health research impact assessment.
